paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the Val122Ile variant of the TTR gene, its implications in Familial Amyloidal Cardiomyopathy, and the binding interactions of ligands with this variant.

patients.demographics: Approximately 3% of the African American community carries this mutation.

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant destabilizes the TTR tetramer, leading to misfolding and aggregation associated with Familial Amyloidal Cardiomyopathy.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with the hereditary form of FAC.
variants.population_frequency: Approximately 3% in the African American community.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on population frequency and clinical association.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is one of over 100 point mutations reported in the TTR gene.
key_quotes: Approximately 3% of the African American community has been shown to carry this mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR gene and its variants.
